text: Everyone passes the electronics store without stopping to see Terrance and Phillip. Death is about to touch Kenny when Kenny decides to defend his life

text: (Take that!)  (And that, that is for me, and that, that and that, that and that, that, that, that!)

text: (Oh, yeah)

text: Well, who really cares what that monster is outside? As long as we stay on the bus, it can't hurt us. Right?

text: AAAAH!

text: (Uh oh. Hey uh, you guys! Help me doooowwwwnnnn! Heeyy, you guuuuyyyyys!)

text: back at The Tonight Show, Ms. Cartman's segment has just started

text: Was it? Does it even matter?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Wwhat do ya mean?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Success is hollow, Mitch, hollow like a dead tree. I think it's time for me to give it up.

text: Are you sure?

text: Ah-I'm sure. Let's get a cup of coffee.

text: Daytime. The sun is shining into the bus through the roof

text: We've just gotta stick together.

text: Hay, wait a minute.

text: Remember the time when Fonzie jumped over the buses with his motorcycle?

text: You bastards!

text: Now, that's what I call a sticky situation. Uheheheh, heh.

text: You dumbass, Cartman! That's not the way it happened!

text: Don't worry. Everything's gonna work out. It always does.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Sure. Remember that time that that kid in the red shirt decided to go off on his own?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER

text: not to wait for help to come, but to go and look for help himself]

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Ehah! Well, I'm not gonna sit here and wait to die with the rest of you! If I can make it back, ah-I'll send help.

text: Don't do it, kid.

text: the kid hops off the bus and the rest of the class goes over to the left side of the bus to see him off

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Hmm. Maybe Ms. Crabtree did make up that stuff about the big black monster.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: the boy turns around and smiles. The bushes behind him rustle. The kids look stunned as the monster comes out of the trees and traps the boy

text: Nooooo-agh!

text: Holy crap, dude!  Hey look! He's got ice cream!

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Hooray!  Yea!  Aaah!  Yea! Ha ha.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Now, that's what I call a sticky situation.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: A marsh. Ms. Crabtree and the truck driver are enjoying a quiet moment

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Wow, this is gorgeous. I don't think I've ever seen anything so beautiful.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: From a distance, this place looks like a cold, damp marsh. But once you get inside it,  you realize that it has an inner beauty, far surpassing others. Thank you for sharing your time with me, Ms. Crabtree.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Please. Call me Muffin.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: I'm having a nice time, Muffin.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Me too, Marcus. I've forgotten all about my cares in the world.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: The precipice. All her cares are still waiting for someone to rescue them.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Aw damn, man. Now I'm missing the new Barnaby Jones.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Hey. Ms. Crabtree had that little TV, for the trainng video? Maybe we can watch TV on it.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Hey yeah!

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: And all over America, kids are turning to the streets and running away. Tonight, a very special message from the parents of some runaway children, in hopes that their young will hear their cries.

text: Hello, Stanley. It's me, Poppa.  Gosh, your mother and I miss ya. And I hope that wherever you may be, you'll hear this message.

text: at Kyle]

text: Runaway, come home. We love you just as you are.

text: The Marshes, the Broflovskis, the McCormicks, Liane Cartman, Mr. Garrison (!), Kevin's mother, and three unidentified adults. One of them seems to be the ice cream man from Cartman's flashback.]

text: Dude, did it ever occur to them to just look for us?

text: Wait, wait wait wait. This doesn't make sense. This whole thing doesn't make any sense. I must be-

text: Cartman's bedroom

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Deah, eh eh.  Oh man, what a weird dream!

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Ah-are you okay, hon?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Ma? I just dreamt that me and Stan and Kyle and Kenny were trapped on our bus, and we were talking about everything that happened to us, except that it was all wrong and everything ended with us eating ice cream.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Oh. Well. Wwould you like some beetles for breakfast?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Mmmm.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Mmmm.  Mmmm.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Stan's bedroom. Stan is asleep

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: GAAA-uh.  Ugh. Oh, dude. What a nightmare.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Hello?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Dude, I just had the weirdest dream.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Really?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Yeah, I dreamt that Cartman dreamt that we were all trapped on a bus, and then he dreamt that we were talking about things that had happened, only they were all wrong, and, and then he and his mother ate beetles.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Dude. That's a pretty fucked up dream.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Yeah, I must be having some real emotional problems.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Hey. Me and Cartman and Kenny are going down to Happy Burger. Do you wanna come?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Sure. I definitely don't wanna sleep anymore. See you later.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: The marsh. Cartman's dream has a life of its own and is self-aware, like a holodeck program gone awry. A frog croaks

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: I want to thank you for making me feel alive again, Marcus.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Mms. Crabtree?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: What is it? What's wrong?

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: You realize I can't stay. None of this is real: it's it's all been a little eight-year old's dream

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Oh I know. I know, Marcus. But let me just pretend as long as I can.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
text: Sure.

title: CITY ON THE EDGE OF FOREVER
